WS_1
/*
* Recursive solution to Towers of Hanoi problem
*/
class HanoiTower {
	public static void main(String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception {
		shift_disk(3,0,2,1);
	}
	
	public static void shift_disk(int n, int from, int to, int via) {
		if (n == 1) {
			System.out.println(+ from + "->" + to);
		} else {
			shift_disk(n - 1, from, via, to);
			shift_disk(1, from, to, via);
			shift_disk(n - 1, via, to, from);
		}
	}
}

> 0->2
> 0->1
> 2->1
> 0->2
> 1->0
> 1->2
> 0->2
WS_2 import java.util.Scanner; import java.util.InputMismatchException; public class HelloWorld{ public static void main(String[] args) { int secretNumber; secretNumber = (int) (Math.random() * 99 + 1); Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in); int guess; do { System.out.print("Enter a guess (1-100): "); while(true) { try { guess = input.nextInt(); break; } catch(InputMismatchException e) { System.out.print("Invalid input, try again: "); input.next(); } } if (guess == secretNumber) { System.out.println("Your guess is correct. Congratulations!"); } else if (guess < secretNumber) { System.out.println("Your guess is smaller than the secret number."); } else if (guess > secretNumber) { System.out.println("Your guess is greater than the secret number."); } } while (guess != secretNumber); } }

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		String x= "Red";
		System.out.println("Hello World!"); 
		System.out.println("Chester Holtz");
		System.out.println("My favorite Color is: "
				+ x);

} // end of class
